title: Slack/Teams Always-On Anxiety
context: Organizations adopt Slack, Teams, or similar tools to replace email and reduce meetings. The promise: async communication that respects everyone's time. The reality: a firehose of messages that creates a new kind of always-on anxiety. The green dot becomes a surveillance signal. Channels multiply until nobody can keep up. And the 'async' tool becomes synchronous — people expect immediate responses, creating a more demanding communication environment than email ever was.
hypothesis: Chat tools like Slack and Teams improve communication and reduce email overload.

chain.root: Adopt real-time chat as primary communication tool

effects.label: Communication volume explodes — messages replace emails AND meetings
effects.impact: Average employee sends/receives 200+ messages per day

children.label: Channels multiply — 50-200 active channels per team
FOMO drives people to join more channels than they can follow
Important messages buried in noise — critical info missed

effects.label: Async tool becomes synchronous — immediate response expected
effects.impact: Average response time expectation: under 10 minutes

effects.label: Context switching becomes constant

Limit channels aggressively — archive inactive channels monthly
Ban after-hours messages or use scheduled send
